thread.title: Ranji Trophy: Varun Khanna spins Punjab to innings win
thread.title_full: Ranji Trophy: Varun Khanna spins Punjab to innings win - The Times of India

author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
title: Ranji Trophy: Varun Khanna spins Punjab to innings win
text:
MOHALI: Left-arm spinner Varun Khanna registered his best first-class bowling figures to guide Punjab to an emphatic innings victory over Railways in their opening Group B Ranji Trophy cricket match, here on Sunday.
Following on, Railways' second innings folded for 282 runs in 68 overs with Varun taking 8/97 as the hosts won by an innings and 126 runs.
At the start of the play on Day 4, Railways were 125/5, needing 283 runs to save the innings defeat. But they failed to make Punjab bat again, falling one run short with Varun, who took all five wickets in the visitors' second innings on Saturday, doing bulk of the damage.
Arindam Ghosh waged a lone battle for Railways with an unbeaten 98 as wickets kept tumbling from the other end.
Besides Varun, Maninder Singh (1/69) and Yuvraj Singh (1/17) were the other wicket takers for Punjab.
Earlier, Punjab declared their first innings after posting a mammoth 604 for five. Gurkeerat Singh made an unbeaten 201, while wicketkeeper Gitansh Khera (102*), Uday Kaul (112) and Mandeep Singh (109 also recorded centuries in Punjab's first innings.
By virtue of this win, Punjab pocketed seven points, including two bonus points from the match while Raiways returned empty-handed.
Brief Scores: Punjab 604/5d in 171.1 overs beat Railways 196 & 282 all out in 68 overs (f/o) (Arindam Ghosh 98*; Varun Khanna 8/97) by an innings & 126 runs.
Points: Punjab 7, Railways 0
